page.title: 02LOWER FOLD FARM PLEASINGTON.
page.content: {Lower Fold Farm}is one mile west of Blackburn town centre.It is{380 acres} in area and has a {clay}soil in the { east and{sand}in the west.The farmer{ {Mr.Pawson}owns{100 Charolais}and{220 {Freisians}which are used for cross -breeding.He produces{200 gallons}of milk per day.Some milk is transported by{tanker}to the{Coop}in Church near Accrington,the rest is delivered to homes on the farms{milkround.}Cattle that do not produce milk are used for {breeding}purposes.He owns about{60 {Blue Faced Leicester}sheep for showing { Mr.Pawson}grows{grass}for animal feed but they are also fed on{cattle cake. The{main buildings}on the farm are{one {hundred cubical}sheds for{cows}and the dairy where{six cows}can be{milked}at once.There are only{four full time {workers}and{two}who work{part time} -and so the farm is highly mechanised.
